Audio

Class StereoSplit

  • java.lang.Object
    • Audio.StereoSplit

  • public class StereoSplit
extends java.lang.Object
    Splits a stereo audio file in to two mono arrays (left and right). Also can converge two mono arrays in to one stereo array.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StereoSplit() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void convergeMonoArrays(float leftGain, float rightGain)
      Converge two mono array channels (left & right) into one stereo array channel.
      float[] getLeftArray()
      Get left channel.
      float[] getRightArray()
      Get right channel.
      void setPanning(float[] monoArray, float gain)
      Set panning positions of stereo audio.
      void split(float[] trackBuffer)
      Split a stereo float arrays in to two mono left and right channels represented as new float arrays.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • StereoSplit

        public StereoSplit()

    • Method Detail

      • split

        public void split(float[] trackBuffer)
        Split a stereo float arrays in to two mono left and right channels represented as new float arrays. For 16-bit stereo audio files, each sample will take 2 bytes. (24-bit may be different).

      • setPanning

        public void setPanning(float[] monoArray,
                       float gain)
        Set panning positions of stereo audio.

      • convergeMonoArrays

        public void convergeMonoArrays(float leftGain,
                               float rightGain)
        Converge two mono array channels (left & right) into one stereo array channel. This new stereo array will be the result of processed audio (panning/volume/EQ).

      • getLeftArray

        public float[] getLeftArray()
        Get left channel.

      • getRightArray

        public float[] getRightArray()
        Get right channel.
